5 stars for theme! Thought the game hit both targets perfectly. Mad props for drawing the art yourself! That's a lot of work and everything held together for me. Couple of specific suggestions from me for future versions: 1) it would be really cool to experiment with a time pressure mechanic, or maybe a speedrun mode where you try to get the most puzzles done on a leader board. 2) You should look into custom CSS for your game pages! With your illustration skills you could add a lot of polish! Nice work!

Cute game! Hey there BF! Nice work on a rock solid arcade game. I played it a half dozen times and never even got CLOSE to the leaderboard, but it was really fun. Haha. The sprites were adorable. The itch page was complete, inviting, and told me everything I needed to know (which is weirdly rare in jams... why don't people do that? It's so little work compared to all the coding and stuff.)Anyway, since you seem like a super chill guy who sincerely wants a lot of feedback, I've made a few notes. Take 'em or leave 'em! ... hope something in my rambling is helpful, in no particular order. (AND YES this is an invitation to please give me absolutely any criticisms on my games so I can get better)  Now, these are more about the game than the graphics... which I completely get isn't the point of this round... but anyhoo...1) I found the score super motivating... it would cool if the score was way bigger so I can read it without taking my eyes off the action.2) on that note, it would be cool to see the lowest score on the leaderboard displayed above my score (or maybe even a "fake" leaderboard score that tempts to try one more time) ... anything to up that sweet tension as the player gets closer to their next goal. Maybe at 10,000 points you get a new rocket or something haha I never got that far? If so it would be cool to see that goal as I'm chasing it.3) With so much going on, it'd be interesting to knock back the background stars to 30% or 50% and see if that helps the sprites pop ('course that might actually take away some of the challenge)4) The protag flashes (I think to indicate a period where you're invincible) but the flash is a little slow so it makes it hard to see where your rocket is while it's invisible. Might be interesting to try flashing 2-10x faster so the eye doesn't lose the rocket's location.

I did complete the game on another playthrough though with the gravity and shield orbs but I had to carefully use the bullet orb on one pesky placed one in the top right corner. In Construct 3, bullet stepping might fix the collisions. I didn't see a win screen or another level afterwards and the reset button didn't reset the game. This round is about the art so I guess some things like that can be ironed out in later rounds. I think it could be cool if you could have a max of 1 of each orb on the screen so that it speeds the gameplay and gives the player more to do. I'm thinking the spectacle of space was the theme you chose and the nuclear fusion of the stars was the fusion modifier but correct me if I'm wrong. Great spooky game. I was fun running through the house trying to find all the items while looking out for a ghost. I didn't see a ghost but manage to banish it. I'll come back to this to and see if I can be attacked by the ghost.

The overall art and vibe of this game is the best I've seen so far, it was incredible. The way the player looks through spectacles to see, and the fisheye effect are greatly done, I do wish the gameplay itself had more pace to it however. It may have been a me issue, as I was not able to find the salt, and then went downstairs and apparently had the salt the entire time, but otherwise amazing entry!

Excellent job with the narration and effects . You nailed the 'atmosphere'. I clipped through a wall and couldn't move anywhere. So I didn't play all the way through. But what I did play, was really well done!!
Unfortunetly no game in sight. Maybe next year :(

The fireworks look really great and I like the drawer animation, although it was difficult to drag them out at times and when dragging it over the red buttons it spins the wheel so I had to be more careful on that bit. This game was a cool concept and visually created a spectacle using fire works to defend the earth. Could benefit from a slower more guided start teaching controls and gameplay concepts. Sound and presentation was solid, great game ð
Interesting concept. Took some time for me to figure it out, but it was fun once I got it.
I'm a little confused about the controls, but it's cool how you mixed 2d and 3d here. I'm guessing that's the fusion part?
This was a really cool idea.  I think for a game with really different controls, it can feel less intuitive at first, so I think a little more tutorial would have helped, but I liked it!
I was a bit confused on how to load up the bullets at first, but after that it was a cool concept to switch between two screens to fight. Nice job!

This game looks really well made, and it definitelly needs some more content, I read how it relates to the theme, it kinda makes sense, but it isnât really obviousâ¦  maybe you could have added so the scientist go to the other rooom with cameras, and then you are released on purpose, rather than an âaccidentâ overall the game is really fun, and looks so stunning

I liked the mix of physical and psychic attacks and building weapons from the remains of the defeated enemies. The effect when you get to crush the drones was great. Had a lot of fun playing this and the art style was great as well.
Really cool art style. The effect on the character's hair and the cables really impressed me. Very cohesive, this looks great!

For this roundâs criteria, Iâd say itâs definitely a fun and cohesive style! The hair flowing animation was a nice touch as well. Felt a little light on the connection to the theme is the only nit in that regard.
This was really cool!  Right away the art and story grabbed my attention.  Would love to see this expanded into a full game!
This is incredible, such an awesome ability and you've presented it all so well too
This is an awesome entry! The art and atmosphere are great and the juicy particles and shaders make it feel awesome, nice job :)
Amazing! I really hope you keep working on the game i love the feel and atmosphere. I am really impressed with how much you were able to get done!
Atmosphere is reallllllyyyy good here, and the use of procedural pixel art goes a great overall look to the game. The telekinesis power is great, want to see more of this so i can crush more bots.
What you have is really nice. The art gives me "Another World" vibes. You've created an eerie atmosphere, and I like it!!

The spectacle mechanic was implemented very well, and I liked how well the mechanics of leading the tiny creatures and switching worlds was implemented (especially on the main menu)! I'd suggest allowing the player to switch to a different spectacle color, even when they have the "circle" spectacle up, by clicking on a different color on the wheel, rather than having to right click to cancel.
gAME LOOKS GOOD WOULD HAVE BEEN MORE FUN IF MY JUMP WORKED TWT
The jump wasn't working on my laptop, or another laptop, but it worked on my desktop. Well done game that was well polished and looked great!
unfortunately, I can rate this correctly but from what I have scene I think it looks fun lol ,
I love the way you change colours its super satisfying. Unfortunately I ran into the jump bug as well so I couldn't play too much, but the aesthetics are awesome great job :)
So good! wish there was more to play

Looks like I unfortunately ran into the jump bug as well (tried on both Chrome and Firefox, also I'm on Windows 10). Like others though, I don't hold it against you too much, because I can tell there's a lot of polish and juice in this entry! I really wish I could play it properly, let me know when you get the jump fixed.

This art style, with all the juice, flows together really nicely! I enjoyed how it showed a preview of the next color as you were picking it, that was a cool effect. Amazing entry!! I am really looking forward to you continuing this in round 2! I really loved it!
I LOVED this one.  The visuals were so good.  Very impressed with the way you could look with a lens before activating.  All the stars for this.
Love the smooth animations and masking!

Cool entry ! The switching mechanics is a bit tedious and i would have loved to be able to pass just by hovering the circle (not changing the whole level). Anyway the idea and artstyle are amazing. Good job !
Holy cow, I'm extremely impressed. This game is so polished and satisfying to play. I absolutely love the core mechanic and I would play so much of this in a full game.
I can't seem to figure out how to get past the first level. Seems like it's not jumping high enough?
The game looks good, and I like the planting and growing crops.

Even though the game isn't as finished as you'd like, you've still managed to create quite a lot actually and there's always room to expand it in future rounds. Also the art is excellent and really nicely animated

beautiful graphics! i love idle farm games so it would be awesome to see this idea completed! I really enjoyed the scene and atmosphere! I know you didnt get everything done in time but what you do have is well polished! great job!
Cool Art and "game juice!" Do you have plans on working on the game more? Also where you able to use the Spacespy - minute? Just wounding.
This game looks super good.  Interested to see how it grows!

Love the atmosphere! Your pixel-art-game is always on point. You did some really interesting things with the path finding. I like it! Doors/gates opening on their own is a nice touch too. I was looking forward to see what you'd come up with in the 1st round. Did not disappoint :)

Pretty cool demo for online functionality, I know construct isnt the best for it (I did online leaderboards for my entry). the art is really nice, and I enjoy when characters are randomized. Once again though, the pixel art is great, I almost want to use it to make another small game after this jam is up lol
I know life sucks, but you did some amazing art, which is a focus of this round, I wouldnât count you out just yet, and thereâs a wildcard so the judges could give you a second chance afterall

The player walk cycle looks really good. I also like, that theres a different sprite for jumping, which fits. There are a lot of cool little details in the room. Good thing your better now, i am excited to see your project next year :D
What little was there, I really liked. Sorry about having to go hospital.

So sorry to hear you had to go to the hospital!  I know that can be hard when life happens when you're excited to work on something.  But also, this round is mostly focused on art, and your art was a lot of fun!  Don't count yourself out just yet.  You might still have a chance.
The intro was promising ! Congrats for submitting. Hope you stay well !

Look the hardest part is actually submiting your game, honestly. Good job on wrapping up what you had and also having the curage to submit it! It really is a good start and it left me with wanting to know more!!
I hope you stay well. What you've made is awesome, I like the art and storyline and general direction the game is going in
Hey, it's awesome that you submitted what you had. This is the art round, and you've got some great art it's clear you spent a lot of time making.
hope you get well soon. â¥ï¸
Great game, love the movement of the eyes as if, "Don't you dare add more stickers to my glasses".
Great idea for a game and I'm especially liking the eye movement

This was super fun! I loved the art style, and I think you implemented the theme and modifier well!
Great art style!
I really liked the art style!  I got Mario party mini-game vibes from the gameplay, too.
Dang guy won't sit still. A fun entry.

The art matches the gameplay really well. I really like the simplicity and quirkiness. Reminds me of the WarioWare games. Might be good to add some kind of animation or effect to hint at when the person is about to move. Overall really great!

Colors and fonts and everything really hangs together. The gameplay was a little simplistic, but HEY that's totally okay since this round was all about the graphics. Big score on both themes for me. THANK YOU THANK YOU for explaining how your game applied to the theme. I don't understand why everyone doesn't do that. Hahaha. Biggest vote for next version would be a proper walk cycle for the heroine... but that's a lot of pixel work and I completely get why you chose to get the core game working great before worrying about that. The game image (icon? splash? you know, the thingy that shows up in the submission list) is the best of the jam for me. Colorful and inviting. Nice work.

I like this game. A very cute idea. I love the way everything looks, it has the realistic pixel vibe that some games had back in the 90s when they were more limited in resolution. This is definitely high on my list of games this round.

The tree art is amazing, well done! I did find it odd how the fireballs didn't go away with the umbrella up, it was hard to tell when you blocked them since they didn't have feedback. I did like how there was the flowers falling to just throw you off, nice entry!
Nice art ! Game was slow but that gave a nice mood to it. Congrats !
The artwork in the game is really great. It was pretty fun.

I love the art, and I really enjoyed playing this! Sometimes I was a bit confused on whether I got hit or not, but it was still super fun! I loved the mechanics with the umbrella as well, required a bit of strategy deciding whether to risk getting hit to pick one up.

Good job, Sorry if I get a little nit picky at the end but   I do I a few suggestions/some feedback, ,a little more feedback to player when getting hit or maybe even when collecting coins would be nice, I would have like to see some sort of oh hey the timer is going to run out so maybe speed up the music or something idk, Idk how optimized the visual scripting is but there is a bit of a delay between clicking any menu button and going to where the button takes you I pressed the story then the score board and the story started to play a few seconds after entering the score board, a custom cursor for the mouse I often found myself having to shake my mouse to figure out when  it was or maybe a hover effect maybe just a lighter tint on the menu buttons if anything , I felt The players art was not an exact match for the art in your game, other then that not issue with game play Good job and Good luck

I really liked this game! The visual style, the music and sounds and especially the leaderboards. (as you can probably tell if XD, im on there quiet a bit) also if anyone can beat my score ill be back! Great job!

I really like the visuals, and the music fits really well, but the hit sound is just hilarious, and also I think its a pretty unique mechanic of choosing between defending/colleting points that could defintelly be explored moreâ¦
The art is really nice. The blocking and picking up is a good mechanic, it has a lot of potetial. Cherry Blossoms are quite spectacular indeed.

All of the artwork is nice which is the main focus this round.  I really liked the gameplay, especially having the ability of lifting and lowering the parasol. There are some things that could be improved - the character walk animation and the score doesn't seem to match the leaderboard score but having a leaderboard is awesome
I liked the coin collection method â¦. also the dragon can we have its power ?>////
Really lovely art, and I really liked your use of multi-layer parallax!
Your game caught my eye because my entry also includes sakura trees. :) Your game's visuals are lovely, and everything is implemented well! It's a fun little game and pretty responsive.
Very neat game. It's interesting seeing a multiplayer game in a game jam. I think I'll have to try it out with a friend to truly appreciate it, though.
The game has a lot of good things going for it, the art style and the concept are great.

You got a LOT done in just one day of development.
The art looks great and the music fits well.

A little buggy with when text pops up and how long the sword interaction holds (though maybe thatâs actually intentional and I just didnât read it that way), but nice to see a few stages to give a sense of the variety this world can give. Music fits nicely, and the sprites themselves are really solid. Not bad for one day of development to be clear, I wouldnât have made it as far!

For only having worked on it one day, this is quite impressive.  The time scale slow on kill effect was a really good touch.  And having multiple stages was cool.  Wasn't expecting that on the first playthrough.
It being two players made it hard to test out, but the overall concept is pretty cool. I like the samurai art, nice job!

This is really nice. The gameplay loop is solid, I could see this turning into a cool rogue-like or something. The art and fx work really well too. Particularly like the mining sound effect, was very satisfying. Nice job :)
Very fun gameplay loop, I like the spectacle feature and all the game juice while shooting. Neat game!

This is a really good entry! I love the approach to the theme and the modifier. Great game design :) The art works well togherther. I didnt like the pixelated effect, it was a bit hard on the eyes. I think it is the way, the camera moves smoothly to the player. Maybe try an instant moving camera on that effect.
With a few more things added I think this could become a really cool rogue like!  Good job!
game was great, really fun but a bit repetitive
As is I really enjoyed it, but I can see this game getting even better by adding more and more to it. Well done.
Really great entry with a great art style. Can't wait to see more.

This works so well on so many levels! The artwork and effects used really sells the theme(s). The whole experience legitimately felt like watching an old film reel with scratches and wobbly frames. Your storyline had me laughing and made the game even more enjoyable. That music clearly matches the artwork... perfectly! The simplicity of the game allows you to enjoy the show while still satisfying a nice little boss battle. A job well done!!

Great job! I really like the aesthetic and visuals. It could use some volume control in round 2, but i dont really have anything bad to say. You did a great job. I love the story so far and I am looking forward to chapter 2
Great entry given the criteria. Really nice package with a great cohesive art style. Really enjoyed playing this as well.

Short, fun, silly, and sticks the landing with the ending! I think the old film effect could be toned downat least a little, but I can also appreciate wanting to ramp it up to 11 for the art-round entry of GDKO. Also love the idea enemy combo of spectacle vs monocle, nicely played! Looking forward to seeing this rivalry expand, unless indeed it was their inevitable death I guess haha (next round = prequel??)

You did a LOT with a little! It feels like you scoped this really well. The boss fight is fun and engaging without being difficult. The effects really sell the game, though--especially the film grain. That combined with the sound design for the projector and the ragtime music made for an excellent experience.

Dear Sir Spectacles!,
You have bravely fought against the 8 handed monsterâ¦
I wanted you to win and deep in my heart i do believe that you defeated it.
But am eagerly waiting to have your SPECTACULOOOR entry back ..

You did a great job with this one. The story and characters are charming and the aesthetic is spot on. Love it :)
Great artstyle! I love all the animations, the game feels really polished. The bossfight is very fun. Well done!
This game is beautiful! I love the old film visuals and the piano music hits perfect. Thanks for making this, i loved it

Really fun entry. Like alot of other have said you truly transported me back to the era of silent films. The presentation truly kicks ass. I had to go and show a couple of friends while playing it was so good. I love how you did spectacle in a couple of different ways. I feel like the player is a spectator, the story line was spectacle focused and the character designs, to the explosion at the end. ALSO love the story, Im a sucker for any narrative. Id love to see what happens next.
Love the silent film aesthetic. Great use of the theme. I can't wait to see where you go with this.
I hope you continue the game, it's really excellent! The storytelling is good and the vintage aesthetics are a nice touch and I love the eyes and birds animation on Mr Monacle too

It's short but really nice entry ! You nailed the silent movie aesthetic perfectly. I want this to be continued on next round !!

First thing to stand out was great story telling along with a good sense of humour :), you were the first one I played so you may have got some free bonus points as I have no comparisons. With your tip I am glad I got the full experience, to be continued...

The art style is absolutely incredible, it's so cohesive and unique! I especially loved the opening sequence the 3 2 1 was just so perfect!! It was super fun to play as well, hopefully one day will find out what happens next!
Very fun lil game! Loved the art style and the old-timey look of things! I know you'll get this a lot, but it definitely gave me Cuphead vibes!
Loved your game

You pulled off old-timey black and white film vibe really well. The sprite animations are really good too. I think the explosion at the end could've been expanded with more effects/sounds to give a better pay-off for winning.
Love this game! Whats going to happen next????

This was a really good game! The art was absolutely amazing and had a lot of charm. I also really loved that grain on the camera as well as the slight shake which made it feel like a real old movie.  I did find the gameplay a little simple but I know this isn't really the round for that. I cant wait to see where this game goes!

Beautiful entry, can't believe I hadn't gotten to this one yet! You've absolutely nailed the old-timey aesthetic, and have me hooked on how it'll continue. Would love to see you develop this game further!
You really got me hooked, I want to find out what happens next so baaaad, and I love how the name of the game is a pretty tough toungue twister

BEST WRITING OF THE JAM. Seriously, made me laugh out loud. The old timey scratch look is so good. Super smart move to get fusion into the game in like, ten ways it felt like hahahaha. The game itself is a little basic, but that's cool. Not the point of this round! Gosh... if I had to think of a couple of suggestions... 1) it would be nice to be able to click to advance / skip the intro, for like when you come back to play again. 2) I like the idea of the different fonts for the characters, but I think the handwritten font doesn't quite fit the old timey theme as well as the main fonts. Anyhoo, great entry.
I pressed F and the game died, I think I found the secret ending. Anyways pretty basic but fun and looks nice with the retro vibe. I like it.

I really like the artstyle on this game, its so cute, as others have mentioned, some animations and/or effects wouldnt be bad, and thereâs a small problem when the charather falls, you canât get back up so easily as the camera stays on that part of the tower, but overall this is a sweet and cute game

Fun little game! The art and sound design fit really well together. I agree with others that I wish there was more juice. I especially would have liked smoother screen transitions between levels. I also had an issue where I just couldn't do the next level because it didn't seem to link up to the one before it in terms of collision shapes.
Great to see a fellow blob game :)
I'm always down for a fun little jumping game.
For only having 2 days to work on it, this is nice.  The basics are all there.

I really enjoyed the fact your HP falls constantly, and it is at the same part with the timer. So as a player I only have to look at one part. Great work on such a complex game! And at making all the art I assume!

As others have mentioned, a little bit more animation and juice would have been nice, but it's a very fun and intuitive little game!  I liked that I could tell what was going on, and the little collectibles were very clear on what they did.

The design of the monsters isn't too bad and I like that you've got one that moves sideways, I would have loved to see more movement and animation in the other ones. There is quite a number of bugs but considering you made the game in just 2 days, it's kinda expected and you've done pretty well with the time you had

Though at first I thought it was a bit broken, after a couple tries I was able to get past the second room frame. An interesting idea of a game, combining these two genres! Though still a little rough around the edges in terms of falling off the edge or being clear how to jump up to a next stage when thereâs not another platform. From the art perspective (this roundâs theme), was a simplistic - could have used a little supporting animation on the characters or movement.
I really liked the art and juice in this. Would have been great if you had time to implement a little more.
loved the nice confetti popping up! I'm always fascinated with video card games, great, classy choice of art!

The art on the cards is really nice and I like that they are set at a little angle so it looks good when stacking them. As Spike Studio already mentioned, I too think it would be better if you could have all the cards to snap with. I think a time limit to sort each round would be cool and if you make a mistake the game ends, perhaps getting faster each round. Really good game and the screen shake and confetti were great

The juice when placing a card was really nice! I enjoyed the confetti, I so wish I was able to sort all cards though, instead of just the first 3 I decided to go with. I also liked the art of the cards, nice job!
I like the idea, but it feels like you are limited to just 3 pairs of cards, which is a shame, however the game looks really nice and polished, and I like the confetti when you pair up the cards
nice visuals and effects. I would like to see a game loop added on to this project I think you have a good framework for a fun and visually interesting card game!
Great game feel to this, very satisfying animations and screenshake.  The visuals all work together really nicely. Nice work :)
Simple, fun little game! The tweens were great and the cymbal crash added so much to it. I enjoyed trying to time the crash to the music, too.
Nice job on the cards and animating them in & out. Something about the cymbal crash and screen shake that made the whole thing feel satisfying :)
Thanks for the rating and the kind comment Marlin !Will check your game ASAP.
Really nice shooter game. The turret shot are a bit hard to avoid but it look like it doesn't stop you from playing. The music and art are fitting well together ! Congrats !

OH NOOOOO! I don't have a PC so I can't play this game. (I'm on a mac.) It looks so nice from the screenshots. Any chance you could post a video? Obviously a web build would be incredible, but maybe that's not doable with the shaders and stuff. Thanks so much for playing my game and sharing feedback, regardless! Good luck with the jam!
I really liked this game. The art and controls were pretty good, reminds of some 90s PC games I loved when I was a kid.

GameMaker 2 squad represent!  The controls felt super smooth, and the recoil on shooting felt really great.  One thing I'd suggest is maybe less crisp edges around the enemy ship to make it look more natural, but overall the art was good and it was super fun!  Great job!

Ah, my favorite GM2 developer! I was very interested to see what you did with the new particle system. Great job on all the visuals. The mechanics of the game (controls, knockback, etc.) felt just like I expected them to. Great work as usual!!!
Very responsive game! I loved the knockback on the rockets. Made the shooting feel a lot more visceral. Great use of music and SFX, too.
The movement in this game is so fun! Really liked all the visual effects and feedback, it made the shooting extremely satisfying. Nice job :)

There's something to be said for a nice arcade game that follows a known formula. Very fun to play and easy to understand. I like that you experimented with 3D ships instead of just pixel sprites, and I could tell there was a lot of thought in the background and particles back there.
One of my favorite genre of games growing up. Well done with a good variety of enemies.  Only thing missing were some power ups. Well done.
Nice entry! I appreciate the boss fight at the end! most games in this style are never ending so it felt really good to beat it. it was well done!

Nice simple arcade game, really enjoyed the hit flash when your bullets hit enemies. I did find it a bit hard, maybe having the enemies shoot slower, or even convey their shoot with an animation before they fire would be nice. I also really liked the background graphics, nice entry!

Really good fun, I liked the different attacks that the drone fighters did and I made it to the end :) The only thing that comes to my mind on how the game could be improved would be to add a full screen button which can be added by ticking a box during the upload process on itch
I had fun with my peaceful, 0 points, no hit run. Did I actually help to stop the invasion?

The tiny planets were fantastic and fun. It worked great with the gathering and crafting. Too bad you couldn't get as much done as you wanted, that would have really put this game at the top. Great work regardless.

I was very confused even after reading the tutorial, as the others mentioned. But once I understood that the inventory system is litterally picking up items from the world with the cursor I was hooked :) Kept loosing couple of times, but then I found out, when you go to a planet that is already eliminated, you can stay as long as you want :D (its definetly a bug xD) I took my sweet time and crafted some stuff. Unfortunetly I couldnt figure out how the furnace works :/ But I did enjoy my time. The art looks good and there is definetly a hidden gem here
As others mentioned a tutorial would go a long way, but this was really cool!

I had a hard time understanding why I was losing and didnt really seem to be able to collect resources. That said this look so good. I love the visuals, mechanics like the world, map and planet travel. (I said "woah!" when I pulled up the map) and the unique  inventory ui. This could be a great game with full dev time
The visuals look great, I love how the atmospheres on the planets look. I was a little confused about what the goal was but I had a lovely time just watching the sunset :)

Really ambitious project. I was lost on what to do exactly to escape the alien and how to use the spaceship to travel. I may come back later to try to understand better because screenshot looks really promising. The starting planet is really cute !
Please ignore how the title is not set up in the menu, was so tired yesterday when submitting, it completely crossed my mind

Simple and well executed mechanic, it was easy to understand and very fun to use throughout each of your levels! I did encounter a bug at the end of level 3, something with the dialogue glitched out and it didn't let me complete the level unfortunately, would have liked to progress past that and see the final two levels. Regardless though, I really enjoyed the game and your level design! Especially liked seeing a speedrun mode as this game does seem very speedrun-worthy

I like how you added the speedrun mode for replayability, the only thing I donât understand is why is there a timer to the spectacles, I get it that they are magical, but it doesnât make a whole lot of sense, I mean that mechanic is rarely used and you just need 3-4 jumps to reset the timerâ¦ but other than that the game is really cool

I really liked the running animation, and the storyline along the way was a nice way to tie it all together. I said this on stream, but having some indicators when the blocks are changing would be nice, both the timed ones and the ones that swap. It reminds me of the blocks in Mario that swap back and forth, nice entry!
The alternating platforms was fun. The control setup was troublesome for me to get used to, but I eventually got it.

Great job! I loved the leaderboards! the platforming could use some small tweeking. like coyote time and landing on edge. Overall great job! and whoever set those top times is crazy fast!!! also the art is amazing I absolutly loved the player character art
Nice entry.
Nice! I like the design of the character. Might've been cool to incorporate the hat into some of the animations.

This was such a cool idea!  The art style and story were really immersive.  I think the jump mechanics could've been polished a little, as some of the jumps seemed more difficult than they needed to be, but overall a really cool game!

Nice that you had a whole story pulled together here! A couple of the controls werenât very intuitive, you probably could get by with all on-screen buttons to press to navigate but with keyboard shortcuts, but thatâs not the focus of this round anyhow. I do wish I could have seen a snippet of the show though! Pretty impressive though how you must have had all the dialogue branches in this amount of time.

This game is pretty impressive for the short time you spent on it. The dialoge was good, i found some typos, but not a big deal. I tried some different combinations of conversation and everything worked as intended. A neat entry to the jam and definetly a genre i will look more into.
I've been becoming a fan of these kinds of games, I think it was pretty fun and the dialog was pretty entertaining.
I think this is super impressive for only 2 days!! I liked the story, and it linked well with the theme!
Fun game! I like the all the chooses and world map. And only in two day nice work.

Oh I'm so sad! I have a mac so I can't try this one. I'm working on an unreal game myself so I'm super interested to check it out. 2469561.game_title: Stevens Fusion Musical Spectacular - GDKO 2024 - Round 1
comments_raw: This game is really fun. The soundeffects fit perfect. The audience mumbling in the main menu is such a nice touch. At first I was a bit confused where i can change the background, but other than that, the entry ist great. Good Job !

Really strong entry for me. It's a very clever game play idea (which I know this round isn't really about, but it's still impressive.) The animation on the main character is great. If I had a suggestion it would be to experiment with some other fonts that are a little less blocky, to see if you like them better. Good luck with the jam! I'd be amazed (and appalled) if this doesn't advance.
Love the pixel art and animations. They give the game a lot of character. Some of the art and menus could probably use more polish, but overall really great!
What a great idea, that was fun. I can imagine this going farther with more and more things that need to be set up before the curtains raise.
Fun! The art and sound effects were great.
Hey you got the sign in there!  This turned out really good.  The infinity running animation, out of breath animation, etc... just felt so fun.  Good job!

A great idea and pulled off really well. The animation of the character's feet dancing and facial expressions are great and l like how you have to hurry and pick the right props. The sounds certainly add to the spectacle but I didn't realise the background could be changed until reading others comments
I really like the techno fit, and the gameplay loop is fun once you get used to it

Fun! Some nice character to the clapping, and impressive having all sound and so forth in the entry (gives some charm, even if not a criteria specifically for this round). Took me a moment to realize how to change the background, some kind of âhey Iâm interactableâ when you walk by the pulley would be helpful. Also, at first I thought this was somehow going to be some riff off of Steven Universe and Gem fusions haha. Artwork was fairly simple, though still enough that I got the gist of the themes they went with, so kudos there.
Interesting concept, and overall the art was pretty well done. The pixel art is different sizes though, so getting them the same resolution will help keep it fitting together nicely. Cool entry!

I think your game fits the theme super well, and it's a cool concept. I think the props, backgrounds, and costumes fit well together, and you can clearly tell what is what theme. I think this has a lot of potential to be expanded on in the future, in another GDKO round or whatever you want really. I did wish that each game went on for a bit longer though, maybe with more rounds. Great job, I really enjoyed this!! :)
I like the complex movement mechanics and the vibrant artstyle. Neat entry!
I love the art style, I think this game has such a nice atmosphere! It took a bit of time for me to get used to the controls, but once I did, I had a great time!
Nice mix between celeste and geometry dash. The challenge was a bit too high for me at some point but it was fun. Visuals works well together. Good job !
This was really fun and challenging. The visuals were great too.

Definitely could see the Celeste inspiration!  Overall your visuals were really good. There were a few things that started to feel a little busy, like maybe too many after-images for the player.  Still a very cool world and fun gameplay!

I like the platforming challenges with all of the spikes and lasers. I got pretty far but I didn't manage to complete the game, although I might have been able to with some more determination. The player's abilities are cool and the platforms have a nice colourful style too
I see you took a lot of inspiration from Celeste, and I really like the visuals and the movement is really fun, but I think thereâs a little too much camera shaking

The dashing felt good to control, although it was a bit hard for sure. I said this on stream, but I think some color changes would benefit this, as lasers and spikes sometimes were hard to see since the background color was similar. Still, nice entry!

I see what you are trying to go for and it is in fact really fun just the last 3 levels had a very overwhelming difficulty curves, Thi hit box of the player felt a little wonky at times  I think I can make it but then I hit a spike but then I think I am going to die but I hit the same place on the spike and end up getting through alive, other then that I am not sure what the a/d does in the menu exactly.

I really like the idea but for me the camera was really difficult to deal with. i often found myself dying because i could not see what was happening from the camera studdering. I really liked the controls thought and the speed running feeling
Love this game. It takes a minute to get used to the controls but it's sooo worth it.
This game has something addictive, I like how challenging it gets :)
What a great idea of making wings out of the weapons you pick up! Love how you animated the wings growing as you picked up "more" weapons, lol. Would love to see more from this game!
It was fun playing for a bit until I died. I really liked the concept of gathering weapons and using them as wings until you shoot them out.
Really interesting concept!  I love the idea of the weapons becoming the wings.  And well animated, too.

Very cool idea! I love how you animated the wings. It looks surprisingly believable as a physics object. More than I thought it would be for wings made out of weapons. XD I definitely missed the sound/music, so I hope you end up adding to it in the future!
A very original idea, the art is very good and I like how the weapons can be thrown and collected
Making wings from the weapons is a very visually cool idea.
The popping soundeffects were quite loud at the beginning, but otherwise thismightbe a hidden gem
The show most go on, my friend. Nice work!

The music was a pretty good pick. I think some particle effects when passing through a ring would be nice. I liked how I didnt have to do every ring again, after respawning at a checkpoint. I also like the parralax background with all the spectators.One problem I noticed was, that when finishing the game and pressing "R" to restart, the music seems to be played twice ontop of each other.

Awesome job!
You really implemented the âspectacleâ theme well.
Music made the game feel pretty intense and dramatic.

Good job with spectacle and more is more!  Your collision testing only seemed to check the bottom of the main character, so you could slide through boxes connected at the corner, but that's not too big of a deal, just something to watch for next time.  Fun little game!

I made it to the end but I think there was one hoop that I couldn't jump through as it was too high. I like that the hoops went up and down and there's some good platforming in it but I've never been a fan of the castlevania style invisible blocks though. There's things that I like and things that I don't. So firstly, I like what you've done with the stage lights, I like the checkpoint and I think the audience in the background is cool and is cohesive with the design of the main character. I think the balloons would be better if they moved more freely and could be interacted with.  Also, I think it would be cool if all the hoops could change colour after going through them or have a flame around them or something like that
Well done on your entry to the jam.
A decent platformer. Found it a bit irritating a few times, it's not really my thing, but I had some fun.
Pretty fun game! I am a sucker for papers please likes and so I really enjoyed this game. I will say that for a jam game it did feel a little long but It was still pretty fun!
Very interesting gameâ¦ had me playing it for a long time
I love this take on the theme! Nice job :)
Great entry! I briefly had a similar idea when they revealed the theme but I wasn't sure how to design the game play. Making a 'papers please' type of game was a really great idea.
Nice job. I liked the concept and gameplay. I think the rounds were a bit too easy and could have been shorter but the gameplay was great! Great game!

Very unique idea, and well executed! Loved the variation in people generated - some kooky combinations! And fun story built up as we went along. Only gameplay nit (which is not the roundâs category!) is that itâd be nice if I could pull down by clicking anywhere on the machine, I kept moving my mouse there as it somehow felt more intuitive vs the slider.
This was a really unique idea!  I really liked the effect of the blurry letters.  Good job!
It was fun and unique with some pretty funny premises! I would have liked more consistency of line weight and perspective when making a cohesive art style for a game, though
The artwork is really great and getting the right glasses for each customer by doing the eye test was cool. There gets to a point where there's a lot to remember for me but its all good fun

Fun game! It also took me a bit to understand how to pull down the eye thing. The art is crisp and clean and the gameplay definitely fits the Papers, Please vibe of having certain, expanding rules you need to remember.
A very unique game! After I figured out what to do, it was really engaging and fun to pick the correct glasses. Well done!

Super interesting concept, didn't even consider that optimetrist simulator could be a game!I am really bad at remembering these things, so a post it note of sorts that I could check to see what type of customers wants what would have been great (unless I missed that), but I muddled through.The controls threw me off at first, but once I understood in which order I had to click them, it was very smooth sailing. Nice game, the controls were a bit difficult at first.
Food - Burger
Fun game. Took me a bit to figure out I had to pull down the eye thing. After I failed the first guy though it was smooth sailing.

Very cool game, you got a lot of work done in just a few weeks!
The focus/unfocus shader effect was very cool.
I think this is a really interesting interpretation of the theme, this was a fun game, I had a good time playing it! I liked the blurring and unblurring effect when you adjusted the lens as well!
Interesting minigame, I would've never thought to have a game about the eye doctor lol. Simple but nice entry, good job!

2462086.game_title: The Spectacular DJ Dynamo - GDKO Round 1 2024
comments_raw: All visuals look really nice and polished, the atmosphere feels great. Gameplay is fun, but not very challenging. Well done!

Fun memory game, also really love the visual style you've gone for! Mirroring Loten's concern, I thought some of the colors (mainly along the green/blue/purple part of the spectrum) were a bit too similar which ended up causing me some trouble, but that should be an easy fix. Despite the color confusion, I still really liked the color transition effects! If you end up adding to this, you could add another layer of trying to remember the timing of each color in the sequence, in addition to the actual color for each one.
I was not expecting a memory game... lolBut that being said, I really enjoy it! I love the feeling of it and how it feels like you are the DJ and trying to keep the crowd happy!

Your pixel art looks great. You obviously put some time into make the atmosphere look good.
A good idea executed very cleanly.

Itâs great to see how far you have come since last year. Iâm happy to finally see some artwork in your game and the pixel looks great. I wish the gameplay was a little faster pace, maybe instead of doing multiple rounds of the same number, just increase it by one each round. Also, the colors were a bit confusing, especially with the light, the purple/pink and green/blue were a little too similar, maybe some images go to along with the colors. Overall, great job on your round 1.

I think my favorite thing about this game is that it's a great example of scoping appropriately for a jam. You focused on one fun mechanic and did so much with it, and still had plenty of time to make great visuals and add appropriate audio to enhance the experience.
A fun memory game, worked really well with the DJ theme. The colors were different enough to not get confused even with all the lighting effects.

The sound design is great, i like how every color has a different sound, that makes it easier to memorize. I rocked that leaderboard with a solid 13770. To be hones i was compleatly lost once it started to play 7 colors xDGreat game!

I feel like we play similar kinds of games because I always love what you produce. And THE LIGHTS! Such good lighting effects. Im wondering how I can execute something similar in unity. If I could suggest one thing. Adding a royalty free synthwave music playing in the background I think it would add some valuable ambiance to the game. Something like this in the background would go so hard and fit nicely with the sounds you already have.
I have to say, the blacklights was the best. When I had no idea of the sequence, I just turned it all black.
Love all the effects and atmosphere of this game. Was a bit challenging at times to differentiate some of the colours, but overall really nicely executed with awesome visuals :)

Memorize em all da.
Liked the concept and it looks prettyâ¦.
This looks great! Really cool animations and good use of sound.

Really like the lighting effects and the atmosphere you have created, especially with the jumping crowds. Great Job! I love the twist! a few times I would lose and i wasnt sure why so im not too sure what to say about that but overall it was really polished and the animations were great!

I did not expect a memory test xD, I really like the visuals and the music, well done

Very lovely game! It fully flaunts its minimalistic art style, putting the game at the core of the experience. Really fun and addictive ! Reminded me of those good old yeti games. Good job !

Love a good ragdoll sim :D
You did a great job with this one, and Iâm amazed how much you got done during the jam.

I really enjoyed this!! The physics and effects are great, and the gameplay is really fun! It's been great seeing your progress, and I think you should be super proud of your entry, you've done a great job!

tbh I played until I hit 15k and then I stopped myself very fun entire but The art is a bit lacking all the effects are nice, the only think I have to say, is difference between atomic bomb and the normal bomb?
You created a fairly addictive game. I could spend a lot of time in it, but I have to move on playing all the other games.
Fun game! Very addictive with some nice vfx :)
Extremely fun! I played it for a long time. Great audio design, all the visual effects also look awesome. Very well done!
Nice job i thoroughly enjoyed! The nostalgia to old flash games was great. the physics felt clean. great job!

This was a cool idea!  Good job!  Loved the combo of clicking words to write cheesy jokes and shooting tomatoes.
Great use of the two buttons to with the gameplay. Fun game.
I love this take on the theme, it was a fun challenge :)

Nice job! the right click would sometimes not work properly and i would need to mash to get control back. I was playing on browser if that helps diagnose the issue. I liked the jokes and the play on two buttons. really great job there! The concept was also well executed!

nice use of 2 buttons! the visuals were well done and it felt polished!
Simple and fun. You nailed the creepy ambiance of a circus very well. Congrats !

if ori was a weasel :D
